snippet: Displaced New Yorkers and New Jerseyans gathered with their neighbors for the first time since Hurricane Sandy, and balloted with emergency workers.
abstract: New Yorkers and New Jerseyans, displaced by Hurricane Sandy, stream back to their communities in order to vote, gathering with neighbors for the first time since the storm.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER, WENDY RUDERMAN and COREY KILGANNON
byline.contributor: David M. Halbfinger and Corey Kilgannon reported from New York, and Wendy Ruderman from Ocean County, N.J. Ruth Bashinsky contributed reporting from Long Beach, N.Y.; David W. Chen from Monmouth County, N.J.; and Randy Leonard from New York.

lead_paragraph: Displaced New Yorkers and New Jerseyans gathered with their neighbors for the first time since Hurricane Sandy, and balloted with emergency workers.

headline.seo: Those Displaced by Hurricane Sandy Return Home Briefly to Vote
headline.main: Displaced by Hurricane, but Returning Home, Briefly, to Vote
headline.print_headline: Displaced by Hurricane, but Returning Home, Briefly, to Vote
